description: Neuroscience is one of the fastest-growing fields in the sciences, with research
interests ranging from molecular genetics to whole animal behavior. Topics include
membrane biophysics, synaptic transmission and plasticity, intracellular signaling,
sensory transduction, motor control systems, and development. Students attend lectures plus one
Offered annually in the spring semester. Prerequisite: BIO 143 or CH/BI 227 or BIO 227 or PSYCH
